title: People's Party – Reformists
text:
People's Party – Reformists ( or NS-R) is a <a href="liberalism%20in%20Croatia">liberal</a> <a href="List%20of%20political%20parties%20in%20Croatia">political party</a> in <a href="Croatia">Croatia</a>.
History.
The civil initiative for the establishment of the party was launched by former <a href="Croatian%20People%27s%20Party%20%E2%80%93%20Liberal%20Democrats">Croatian People's Party – Liberal Democrats</a> (HNS) chief <a href="Radimir%20%C4%8Ca%C4%8Di%C4%87">Radimir Čačić</a> and his associates Natalija Martinčević and Petar Baranović. More than two-thirds of the party members are former members of the <a href="Croatian%20People%27s%20Party%20%E2%80%93%20Liberal%20Democrats">HNS</a> which left the party because of disagreements with its leadership over the exclusion of <a href="Radimir%20%C4%8Ca%C4%8Di%C4%87">Radimir Čačić</a> from the party while he was serving a prison sentence for unintentionally causing a traffic accident with two fatalities.
According to the parties former acting president Natalija Martinčević, about 200 members from <a href="Croatian%20People%27s%20Party%20%E2%80%93%20Liberal%20Democrats">HNS</a> <a href="Zagreb">Zagreb</a> and <a href="Vara%C5%BEdin">Varaždin</a> branches each have left the party in order to join the People's party - Reformists.
The party's founding congress was held on September 28, 2014 in <a href="Zagreb">Zagreb</a>. <a href="Radimir%20%C4%8Ca%C4%8Di%C4%87">Radimir Čačić</a> was unanimously elected for the first party president.
Election history.
Ahead of the <a href="2015%20Croatian%20parliamentary%20election">2015 parliamentary election</a> the party formed a coalition, "Successful Croatia", with the centre-left <a href="Forward%20Croatia-Progressive%20Alliance">Forward Croatia-Progressive Alliance</a>. In the 2015 election, the party won one seat in the <a href="Croatian%20Parliament">Croatian Parliament</a> in the III <a href="Croatian%20Parliament%20electoral%20districts">electoral district</a>, held by Radimir Čačić. Čačić voted in favor of approving <a href="Cabinet%20of%20Tihomir%20Ore%C5%A1kovi%C4%87">Cabinet of Tihomir Orešković</a>. Party participated at the <a href="2016%20Croatian%20parliamentary%20election">2016 extraordinary parliamentary election</a> as part of the "For Prime Minister Coalition" led by Mayor of Zagreb <a href="Milan%20Bandi%C4%87">Milan Bandić</a>, and eventually won 1 seat. NS-R voted in favor of approving <a href="Cabinet%20of%20Andrej%20Plenkovi%C4%87">Cabinet of Andrej Plenković</a>. At the <a href="2017%20Croatian%20local%20elections">2017 local elections</a>, Radimir Čačić was elected prefect of the <a href="Vara%C5%BEdin%20County">Varaždin County</a> and Darinko Dumbović mayor of <a href="Petrinja">Petrinja</a>. NS-R also entered many county, city and municipal councils, mostly in <a href="Northern%20Croatia">Northern Croatia</a>.
